pages.text: Rose $(l:materials/Gold)gold$(/l) is a $(l:materials/Gold)gold$(/l)-$(l:materials/Copper)copper$(/l) alloy widely used for specialized jewelry. Rose $(l:materials/Gold)gold$(/l), also known as pink $(l:materials/Gold)gold$(/l) and red $(l:materials/Gold)gold$(/l), was popular in Russia at the beginning of the nineteenth century, and was also known as Russian $(l:materials/Gold)gold$(/l), although this term is now obsolete. Rose $(l:materials/Gold)gold$(/l) jewelry is becoming more popular in the 21st century, and is commonly used for wedding rings, bracelets, and other jewelry.
